ratings.comment: I'm still sorry I took my first anthro class from this guy, more than 30 years later.

Extremely knowledgeable.  I wouldn't want to take this course from anyone else.  Plan on reading a lot: he assigns a heavy reading load and I think a lot of people don't read much and wind up having a bad time, but if you read you'll enjoy the class.

Salomon is a really nice old school anthropologist. Emphasize old school. If you want to do well in Anthro 300; memorize EVERYTHING--especially the little details. He's difficult to understand, so be prepared to look up other places. Wish I would've known this stuff.

It's not a hard subject, but he does his damndest to make it unnecessarily so. He overcomplicates things by explaining them in lofty terms and completely kills any interest a person could have in this subject. Take this if you've got a lot of time to devote to readings so you can re-read them and maybe get an idea for what he's talking about. Nice

Dr. Salomon is at times an overflowing pot of words, but they all matter. His lectures are engaging and his level of caring and interest is truly conveyed. Willing to help, interested in student success. Do they readings on time, makes lecture more meaningful and understandable. Almost a history class, the case studies are great.
Worst professeur I ever had. So incredibly BORING. And he assigns the most dreadful books to read. His tests are not that easy either. Avoid him!

very bad lecturer- reads directly from powerpoints that are posted online. for the test- just look at the bold words in the powerpoints and read the assigned reading. most boring and monotonous lecturer I've ever had. Decently easy class, but you will regret taking it with him if you value consciousness during lectures.

All these 104s are giving Salomon a bad rep. He is a good lecturer and hardly ever went over on time. He's not arrogant at all; he just likes to share his experiences because it's what he knows. Anyone who takes a cultural anthropology class and expects NOT to hear about their professor's work should question how they got into UW.

I really enjoyed this class because of my interest in anthropology (later that year I declared an anthropology major). However, I do not recommend this class for those with no interest in anthropology. People I knew who took it just for the ethnic studies requirement often found themselves bored, frustrated, and receiving bad grades. If you like th

Seems like a nice guy, class got pretty boring at times and there were a lot of people and theories to memorize, but the curve at the end helped out a lot. Just pay attention and use the slides to fill out the study guides and you'll be fine.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER! He lectures a lot about his own work, his own opinions, and why he thinks the authors of the books HE chose are wrong about different topics. He must use a thesaurus to find synonyms for every word on his power points which he reads off of; it was very hard to follow. Do not take this class with this professor!!

I took this for my ethnic studies requirement... and fell asleep in pretty much every lecture.  The content was interesting, but the delivery was terrible.  Avoid this prof for this class if possible.

i took this class to complete  my ethnic studies credits after i was told that it was easy and interesting. this was the most useless class ive ever taken. the subject matter could have been interesting, but the professor and ta were horrible. do yourself a favor and dont take this class with this professor!!
BY FAR THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN MY LIFE. LECTURE DOES NOT MAKE SENSE. TERRIBLE TEACHER. BORING CLASS. DO NOT TAKE WITH THIS PROFESSOR!

First of all, this class is the stupidest, easiest class I've ever taken.  Anthro is mostly common sense with some fancy terms sprinkled in.  Salomon basically wants you to know these terms.  Not a great professor, just memorize the underlined words on his slides and you'll get an A in the class.  It's that easy.

Lectures were really boring, but overall the class was easy if you put some effort. First two exams were really easy and then the final was extremely hard. Professors lectures are hard to understand because his choice of words, and spelling/grammar mistakes.
super boring, lecture is pointless, do not take.

Absolutely terrible. Just likes to hear himself talk, but clearly has no iterest in teaching. TA's are clueless as well. By far the worst professor I've had on campus. DO NOT take this class with this professor.

This professor has no idea how to lecture, he flips through slides with paragraphs of text and reads verbatim from a script of flowery prose.  He also assigns tons of reading (5+ books!) and basically expects you to be gullible enough to believe every word he says about anything.  The discussions are also useless, but mandatory.  Easy, but a pain.
has no regards to students whatsoever and enjoys showing off his use of large, unnecessary words.  powerpoints don't make sense, and he reads fromthem word for word.  i do not suggest this class.

Such a bad lecturer.  He would put vocab words on the slides and fail to define them& reads from a script and explains everything in metaphors.  The books were long&boring and it was always a guess as to how much of the test would be on them. A day of a guest lecturer could make up a third of a midterm.  he tried to confuse kids on the test. awful.

Don't. Just don't. However tolerable you think it's going to be, it's not. Literally the worst college experience I've ever had. There is no way this class could have been worse. Completely destroyed any interest I had in the subject. A thoroughly awful experience.

His lectures are boring, and the class is pretty easy. But the material is actually pretty interesting if you want to understand people and diversity. Also, I can tell that he loves the work he does, which is important.

The professor literally writes out his lectures in flowery prose and reads them verbatim.  Lecture is very boring, and there is TONS of reading, although he says he doesn't believe in making us waste time and money on books.  So, only $200 worth of textbooks.  Some books were interesting, but overall, lots of work to learn very little.

Salomon is a super boring lecturer!  He pretty much just reads his slides and that's it and the exams are super hard.  Salomon puts the most random question on exams, mostly stuff that has no importance at all.  The material is semi-interesting, but not with Salomon.  If you have to take this class take it with another professor!!!

Wow, this was the easiest class I have taken thus far at UW. I studied all the underlined words on power points and got an A on the tests. Curves help a lot. Lectures are very boring though. Actually 55% of the class gets a B or greater.. Real simple

Frank Salomon is one of the most boring lecturers you will ever encounter.  There really is no need to attend lecture, because his Power Points are posted online.  The class is not too difficult as long as you do the reading (approximately 100 pages per week).  If you are taking this class for ethnic studies, DON'T!  You will regret it!

His lectures are boring, he speeds through his over-stuffed slides, and his tests reflect mostly text books and guest lecturers. For a 100 level class, this is BS. Loads of reading (most of which doesn't exactly pertain to the class at all), exams that don't cover his own lectures, and THE TAs ARE TERRIBLE.

Worst professor I've ever had. He is extremely boring. The only reason he teaches is because he likes to listen to himself talk. I took him for a 100 level course, but his tests and lectures were written as if it was for a much higher level course. Anthro is interesting, this guy kills it.

Terrible lecturer. Does not explain assignments well, and puts way too much information on each slide and basically reads off of a script or off of the slides.  He is very monotonous and it is hard to stay awake in his class.  Test questions are vague and don't make any sense.

HORRIBLE LECTURER. I don't suggest taking this class unless you want to use it as nap time every day. You never know what's going to be on the test and the TAs are awful. Some of the test questions don't make sense and Prof. Salomon and the TAs refuse to answer questions on them. Material could be interesting but Salomon just ruins it.

BORING! This is possibly one of the most monotonous classes that could exist. He gives you the lectures and doesn't digress too much from them - in fact the majority of the lecture is from the book. Tests are easy if you study lecture and the books. Oh and all the TAs are AWFUL. no help at all.

Terrible lecturer, he puts way too much text on his slides then flips through them rapidly while he reads from a script.  Exams aren't hard if you do the reading, but there is a lot of reading (five books!) so be prepared to learn the material on your own.
Great prof; yes speaks way too softly but lectures are interesting and his digressions are too. He's very passionate about the subject and it grabs your attention. Tests are easy if you study at all.

I agree with the post before me.  I feel like all the other posts are talking about a completely different person.  AMAZING teacher, learned a ton, truly cared about student feedback, tried to be as helpful as possible, very open for office hours help.  Highly recommend. Extremely caring and yes, eloquent.

I feel like I had a different professor than these other raters.  I loved him and the class.  The most clear breakdown of anthro theory I've ever heard.  I could listen to him all day-- incredibly eloquent.  I was engaged all the way through power lectures.  Take him especially if you love S. America
Very bad in lecture. Seems to be a giant ego. I will never take a class with him again.

Yes, Professor Salomon is an old school lecturer, but he really cares about the topic, and his knowledge is impressive. Tests can be very difficult, research paper without any guidance so a bit challenging. Great for students of Latin American culture, would be problematic without previous knowledge. Recommended w/ any interest.
nice guy, but really hard to take notes in his class- it's kinda boring and he's a "low talker"
Absent more often than not...boring...unprepared..nice guy.
AVOID IF POSSIBLE!!
